pr_title: Replace the gremlin-server.sh with a janusgraph-server.sh

timeline.message:
Replace the gremlin-server.sh with a janusgraph-server.sh

Partial fixes #2119

* Replacement for the current gremlin-server.sh
* Improve configurations possibilities for java, such as, gc config

Signed-off-by: Jan Jansen <jan.jansen@gdata.de>

Replace the gremlin-server.sh with a janusgraph-server.sh

* Improve configurations possibilities for java, such as, gc config

timeline.bodyText: As I understand as of 0.2.0 it is still gremlin-server.yaml but as for 0.6.0 it is janusgraph-server.yaml
timeline.author: porunov

timeline.bodyText:
Remove additional dot. I.e. from gremlin-server-janusgraph..yaml to gremlin-server-janusgraph.yaml.
Also, gremlin-server.sh doesn't accept console parameter. I guess we need to change it to janusgraph-server.sh
timeline.author: porunov
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -514,7 +514,7 @@ available to scripts provided to Gremlin Server - `graph` and `g`.
 At this point, Gremlin Server is configured and can be used to connect
 to a new or existing JanusGraph database. To start the server:
 ```bash
-$ bin/gremlin-server.sh conf/gremlin-server-janusgraph.yaml
+$ bin/gremlin-server.sh console conf/gremlin-server-janusgraph..yaml

replies.bodyText: I revert this change. I already created a ticket for this section, see issue #2146.
replies.author: farodin91
